member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Budget.BudgetReportServiceTests
member.summary: Contains unit tests for the BudgetReportService, verifying the generation of raw report data for a full month.
member.remarks: These tests cover a wide range of budget and posting scenarios, including grouped budget purposes, budgets with both positive and negative expectations, fulfilled and unfulfilled budgets, overruns, and postings without budgeted expectations. The tests ensure that the BudgetReportService correctly aggregates, categorizes, and reports financial data based on the defined budgets and actual postings, including the handling of unbudgeted and uncategorized transactions.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Budget.ReportCacheServiceTests
member.summary: Tests for cache invalidation behaviors.

member.summary: Marks cache entries for update when the booking range is inside the cached range.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Budget.ReportCacheServiceTests.MarkBudgetReportCacheEntriesForUpdateAsync_ShouldNotMarkEntry_WhenBookingRangeOutsideCacheRange
member.summary: Does not mark cache entries when the booking range is outside the cached range or cache key prefix differs.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Budget.ReportCacheServiceTests.MarkBudgetReportCacheEntriesForUpdateAsync_ShouldMarkOverlappingMonths_WhenBookingRangeCrossesMonths
member.summary: Marks overlapping monthly cache entries when a booking range spans multiple months.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Files.ING_PdfStatementFileTests_ForOneYear_Of_SavingAccounts2
member.summary: Contains unit tests for verifying the parsing of ING PDF statement files for one year of saving accounts.
member.remarks: These tests ensure that the ING_PDF_StatementFile class correctly loads and reads the content of PDF statement files specific to saving accounts over a one-year period. The tests are intended to validate expected behavior when processing sample statement files.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Files.ING_PdfStatementFileTests_ForOneYear_Of_SavingAccounts2.Test_ING_PDF_StatementFile_ForOneYear_Of_SavingAccounts2
member.summary: Verifies that the ING_PDF_StatementFile parser correctly loads and reads the content of a one-year savings account statement PDF file.
member.remarks: This test ensures that the parser can process a PDF statement file for a savings account and that the extracted content matches the expected result. The test uses a sample file name and an empty byte array as input.

member.summary: Contains unit tests for verifying the behavior of the ING_PDF_StatementFile class when processing a one-year statement file for the third savings account.
member.remarks: These tests ensure that the ING_PDF_StatementFile class correctly loads and parses PDF statement files specific to the 'Extra Konto' account for a full year. The tests validate that the file content is read and interpreted as expected.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Files.ING_PdfStatementFileTests_ForOneYear_Of_SavingsAccount3.Test_ING_PDF_StatementFile_
member.summary: Verifies that the ING_PDF_StatementFile parser correctly loads and reads the content of a sample ING PDF statement file.
member.remarks: This is a unit test method intended to validate the behavior of the ING_PDF_StatementFile class when provided with a specific file name and byte array. The test asserts that the file loads successfully and that the parsed content matches the expected result. This method is marked with the [Fact] attribute and is intended to be run by the xUnit test framework.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.Barclays_PdfAccountStatementFile
member.summary: Represents a Barclays PDF account statement file containing the raw text content of a bank statement for parsing or analysis.
member.remarks: This class provides access to the full textual content of a Barclays account statement in PDF format, exposed as individual lines via the overridden ReadContent method. It is intended for scenarios where the statement data needs to be processed, extracted, or analyzed programmatically. Inherits from Barclays_PDF_StatementFile, and is specific to the Barclays Bank Ireland PLC statement format.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.Barclays_PdfAccountStatementFile.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.Barclays_PdfAccountStatementFile.ReadContent
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of lines from the file content, split by line breaks.
member.remarks: Lines are separated using both Windows ("\r\n") and Unix ("\n") line endings. The returned collection can be enumerated multiple times, and each enumeration yields the same sequence of lines.
member.returns: An containing each line of the file content in the order they appear. The collection will be empty if the file content is empty.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.Barclays_PDF_MultiPage_StatementFile
member.summary: Represents a Barclays PDF statement file that contains multiple pages, providing functionality to read its content as a sequence of lines.
member.remarks: This class extends to support multi-page statement files. Use to access the file's content line by line. This type is intended for scenarios where statements span more than one page in the PDF file.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.Barclays_PDF_MultiPage_StatementFile.ReadContent
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of lines from the file content, split by line breaks.
member.remarks: Lines are separated using both Windows ("\r\n") and Unix ("\n") line endings. The returned collection includes empty lines if present in the file content.
member.returns: An containing each line of the file content in the order they appear. The collection will be empty if the file content is empty.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.ING_CsvGiroAccountStatementFile
member.summary: Represents a sample ING Giro account statement file in CSV format for testing or demonstration purposes.
member.remarks: This class provides a hardcoded example of an ING Girokonto CSV statement, including account details and a range of transactions. It is intended for use in scenarios where a realistic ING CSV statement is needed, such as unit tests or sample data generation. The content reflects the typical structure and fields found in ING's exported account statements.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.ING_CsvGiroAccountStatementFile.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.ING_CsvGiroAccountStatementFile.ReadContent
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of lines from the file content, split by line breaks.
member.remarks: Lines are separated using both Windows ("\r\n") and Unix ("\n") line endings. The returned collection can be enumerated multiple times to retrieve the lines.
member.returns: An containing each line of the file content in the order they appear. If the content is empty, the collection will be empty.

member.returns: An enumerable collection of strings, each representing a line from the file content. The collection will be empty if the file content contains no lines.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Infrastructure.Statements.Reader.Helper.ING_YearlySavingsAccount2_StatementFile

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Reports.ReportAggregationServiceTests.SeedAllKindsAsync(FinanceManager.Infrastructure.AppDbContext,System.Guid,System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Seeds two accounts, two contacts, two savings plans, two securities and creates monthly aggregates for the last N months. For each entity and month two postings are added (1st and 15th), with a global amount counter starting at 1.00€ and increasing by 0.01€ per posting to ensure uniqueness. Returns the created entities, the list of months and a sum lookup for expected assertions.
Hilfsfunktion: Erwartete Monats?Summe je Entität und Vergleichswerte (Vormonat, Vorjahr) aus Seed?Lookup berechnen.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Reports.ReportAggregationServiceTests.QueryAsync_Monthly_AllKinds_VerifyPrevAndYear_ForTwoEntities
member.summary: Seeds 24 months for 2 accounts/contacts/savings/securities with unique amounts (1.00€ + 0.01€ per posting), two postings per month (1st/15th). Builds a monthly report for Bank, Contact, SavingsPlan, Security with comparisons (prev + year) and verifies the latest month's balances for both entities. Expected: Amount equals seeded monthly sum; Previous equals exact previous month; YearAgo equals same month last year.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Reports.ReportAggregationServiceTests.QueryAsync_Monthly_SelectOtherEntities_ShouldBeEmpty
member.summary: With the same seeded postings, query with filters that select non-existing entities. Expect an empty result (no rows).

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Reports.ReportAggregationServiceTests.QueryAsync_VariousIntervals_Bank_VerifySums(FinanceManager.Shared.Dtos.Reports.ReportInterval)
member.summary: Quarterly/HalfYearly/Yearly/YTD/AllHistory: Verify that the aggregation sums match the seeded per-month sums grouped per interval for Bank postings. Previous comparisons are checked for the exact previous interval when applicable, YearAgo for yearly. For AllHistory, verify total across all returned periods equals the seeded total.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Statements.StatementDraftImportSplitTests
member.summary: Tests the import split logic (CreateDraftAsync) for fixed, monthly and hybrid modes. NOTE: MinEntriesPerDraft (new feature) is NOT yet applied by the implementation – tests document current behaviour (TDD baseline).

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Statements.StatementDraftSplitLinkTests.BookAsync_ShouldUseParentBookingDateAndChildBookingAsValuta_WhenSplitDraftsLinked
member.summary: Ensures split-draft postings use the parent booking date and child booking dates as valuta dates.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Statements.StatementDraftSplitLinkTests.ClassifyAsync_ShouldKeepOpen_WhenSplitDraftEntryAmountDiffers
member.summary: Ensures split-draft entries are not marked as already booked when the amount differs.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Tests.Statements.StatementDraftSplitLinkTests.ClassifyAsync_ShouldMarkAlreadyBooked_WhenSplitDraftEntryReimported
member.summary: Ensures split-draft duplicates are detected when re-importing the parent statement entry.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Tests.Statements.StatementDraftUploadGroupSplitTests
member.summary: Tests for booking split drafts that are grouped only by a shared UploadGroupId (multi-part upload) instead of a single explicit SplitDraftId link. Expected behaviour: - Parent draft has an intermediary entry (Contact.IsPaymentIntermediary = true). - User links ONE of the child drafts (same upload group) via SetEntrySplitDraft. - Validation and booking must treat ALL drafts of that upload group (without account + still Draft) as children. - Sum check compares parent entry amount with sum of ALL child draft entry amounts across the group. - Booking parent books all grouped child drafts (and commits them) while unrelated drafts remain untouched.
